net.proteusframework.core.mail

Class MailMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.mail.MailMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class MailMessage
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    This class can be used to generate a multipart MIME message. It is intended as a simple utility to allow developers to easily assemble messages with multiple nested parts without having to have an complete understanding of how to build a MIME message.

    NOTE: Currently this implementation exposes the JavaMail api. This may change in the future.

    Instances of this class are reusable. This class is not thread-safe. Users should call release() when finished creating/sending messages w/ an instance.
    Author:
    Russell Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage()
        Creates an empty mail message object. Remember to call release() when you are done.

      • MailMessage

        public MailMessage(MailDataHandler mailDataHandler)
            throws MailDataHandlerException
        Constructor for the MailMessage object. This constructor builds a message from a MailDataHandler and calls MailDataHandler.close() immediately after exhausting the MailDataHandler. Remember to call release() when you are done.
        Parameters:
        mailDataHandler - the mail data handler.
        Throws:
        MailDataHandlerException - if an error occurs building the message from the mail data handler.

      • addAttachment

        public MailPart addAttachment(InputStream is,
                     String description,
                     String contentType,
                     String disposition)
                       throws MessagingException
        Adds an attachment to this message.
        Parameters:
        is - The InputStream that represents the content of this Attachment.
        contentType - The type of attachment. Examples of content types:
        • "text/plain"
        • "text/html"
        • "image/jpeg"
        • "video/mpeg"
        • "application/pdf"
        • "application/msword"
        • "application/vnd.ms-excel"
        • See the IANA registered media types for additional information.

        description - Description of attachment
        disposition - Determines how this attachment is treated. Examples of dispositions:
        • "inline"
        • "attachment"
        • "attachment; filename=myfile.zip"
        • See rfc 1806 / 2183 for further information
        Returns:
        the MailPart that is used to represent the attachment.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the attachment

      • addBCC

        public boolean addBCC(String email)
        Adds a BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) recipient to the MailMessage object
        Parameters:
        email - the email address
        Returns:
        true on success. False to indicate an invalid email address. If invalid email addresses are a concern, either use one of the other addBCC methods and check getInvalidAddresses() after creating the mime message OR parse the email addresses yourself with InternetAddress.parse(String) or UnparsedAddress.create(String...).
        See Also:
        addBCC(String, String), addBCC(UnparsedAddress), addBCC(InternetAddress)

      • addBody

        public MailPart addBody(InputStream is,
               String contentType)
                 throws MessagingException
        Adds body content to the MailMessage. Multiple calls to this method will generate a message with alternative body content. The alternatives appear in an order of increasing faithfulness to the original content. In general, the best choice is the LAST part of a type supported by the recipient.
        Parameters:
        is - the InputStream representing the body of the message.
        contentType - the content type of the body. Examples of content types:
        • "text/plain"
        • "text/html"
        • "image/jpeg"
        • "video/mpeg"
        • "application/pdf"
        • "application/msword"
        • "application/vnd.ms-excel"
        • See the IANA registered media types for additional information.
        Returns:
        the mail part.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the content.

      • addBody

        public MailPart addBody(InputStream is,
               String contentType,
               String characterEncoding)
                 throws MessagingException
        Adds body content to the MailMessage. Multiple calls to this method will generate a message with alternative body content. The alternatives appear in an order of increasing faithfulness to the original content. In general, the best choice is the LAST part of a type supported by the recipient.
        Parameters:
        is - the InputStream representing the body of the message.
        contentType - the content type of the body. Examples of content types:
        • "text/plain"
        • "text/html"
        • "application/pdf"
        • "application/msword"
        • "application/vnd.ms-excel"
        • See the IANA registered media types for additional information.
        characterEncoding - the character encoding. Only useful for character data.
        Returns:
        the mail part.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the body.

      • addBody

        public MailPart addBody(MailPart mp)
        Add a body part.
        Parameters:
        mp - the mail part.
        Returns:
        the mail part.

      • addBody

        public MailPart addBody(String content,
               String charSet)
                 throws MessagingException
        Adds content to the body of the message. This method adds body content of type text/plain. Multiple calls to this method will generate a message with alternative body content. The alternatives appear in an order of increasing faithfulness to the original content. In general, the best choice is the LAST part of a type supported by the recipient.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the message.
        charSet - the character set. Defaults to US-ASCII if null.
        Returns:
        the mail part.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the body.

      • addBody

        public MailPart addBody(String content,
               String charSet,
               String contentType)
                 throws MessagingException
        Adds content to the body of the message. Multiple calls to this method will generate a message with alternative body content. The alternatives appear in an order of increasing faithfulness to the original content. In general, the best choice is the LAST part of a type supported by the recipient.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the message.
        contentType - the mime type of the content.
        charSet - the character set. Defaults to US-ASCII if null.
        Returns:
        the mail part.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the body.

      • getFilteredMailMessage

        public MailMessage getFilteredMailMessage(MessageFilter filter)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          ParseException
        Get a filtered version of the mail message. This is useful if you want to modify a MailMessage template after doing the filtering / variable substitution. This MailMessage instance is left unmodified so that it can be reused.

        Typically you will call getMessage() on the resulting object instead of getMessage(boolean, MessageFilter).

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter.
        Returns:
        the filtered MailMessage instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error copying the message.
        ParseException - if the filter transforms data in such a way that it can no longer be parsed.

      • getFrom

        public List<UnparsedAddress> getFrom()
        Get the originator of this message.
        Returns:
        List of InternetAddress objects.

      • getInvalidAddresses

        public String[] getInvalidAddresses()
        Call this after a call to getMessage()to get the addresses that are invalid.

        You can also check for valid addresses up-front in your application by using EmailAddressValidator, UnparsedAddress.create(String...), or InternetAddress.parse(String).

        Returns:
        An array of String or an empty array.
        See Also:
        setAddressValidator(EmailAddressValidator)

      • getMessage

        public MimeMessage getMessage()
                       throws MessagingException
        Builds, saves, and returns the message. Calls getMessage(true).
        Returns:
        the mime message.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs building the message.

      • getMessage

        public MimeMessage getMessage(boolean saveChanges)
                       throws MessagingException
        Builds and returns the message.
        Parameters:
        saveChanges - determines whether or not to save the message before returning it. When true the headers of the message are made permanent.
        Returns:
        the mime message.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs building the message.

      • getMessage

        public MimeMessage getMessage(boolean saveChanges,
                     MessageFilter messageFilter)
                       throws MessagingException
        Builds and returns the message.
        Parameters:
        saveChanges - determines whether or not to save the message before returning it. When true the headers of the message are made permanent.
        messageFilter - the message filter.
        Returns:
        the mime message.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an erroir occurs building the message.

      • hasRecipient

        public boolean hasRecipient()
        Returns true if the message has a recipient specified. This method does not validate that the recipients are valid.
        Returns:
        true if the MailMessage has at least one recipient specified.

      • release

        public final void release()
        Release resources held by this MailMessage. This calls MailPart.close() on all parts of the message.

      • removeRecipient

        public void removeRecipient(String email)

        Parameters:

      • setAddressValidator

        public void setAddressValidator(EmailAddressValidator addressValidator)
        Sets the address validator.
        Parameters:
        addressValidator - the addressValidator to set or null to disable.

      • setBody

        public MailPart setBody(InputStream is,
               String contentType)
                 throws MessagingException
        Sets the body content of the MailMessage object. Calls to this method clear any previously set body content.
        Parameters:
        is - The new body content
        contentType - the contentType, such as, plain/text.
        Returns:
        the mail part.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the content.

      • setBody

        public MailPart setBody(MailPart mp)
        Sets the body content of the MailMessage object. Calls to this method clear any previously set body content.
        Parameters:
        mp - The new body content
        Returns:
        the mail part.

      • setBody

        public MailPart setBody(String content,
               String charSet,
               String contentType)
                 throws MessagingException
        Sets the body content of the MailMessage object. This is useful for creating a message with no alternative content.
        Parameters:
        content - the new body content
        contentType - the mime type of the content.
        charSet - the character set. Defaults to iso-8859-1 if null.
        Returns:
        the mail part.
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs adding the content.

      • setMessageIdPrefix

        public final void setMessageIdPrefix(String messageIdPrefix)
        Set the message ID prefix. This can be used to "tag" messages. It is best to keep this to as few characters as possible.
        Parameters:
        messageIdPrefix - The messageIdPrefix to set.

      • setSubject

        public void setSubject(String subject)
                throws ParseException,
                       MessagingException
        Sets the subject attribute of the MailMessage object.
        Parameters:
        subject - The new subject value
        Throws:
        MessagingException - if an error occurs setting the subject.
        ParseException - if the subject contains a line break.

      • setSubject

        public void setSubject(String subject,
              String charSet)
                throws ParseException
        Sets the subject attribute of the MailMessage object
        Parameters:
        subject - The new subject value
        charSet - the character set.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the subject contains a line break.
